Yes, warming up before surfing is important to help prevent injuries and improve your performance. Here are a few recommended stretches and exercises:

1. Shoulder and arm circles: Stand with your feet hip-width apart and your arms at your sides. Slowly rotate your shoulders forward in large circles, then repeat in the opposite direction. This will help warm up your shoulders and upper body. 2. Lunges: Step forward with your right foot and bend your right knee, lowering your body into a lunge. Hold for a few seconds, then return to standing position and repeat on the other side. This will help warm up your leg muscles. 3. Side bends: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms at your sides. Reach your right arm up overhead and bend to the left, stretching your right side. Hold for a few seconds, then repeat on the other side. 4. Yoga stretches: Some recommended yoga poses for surfers include downward dog, pigeon pose, and warrior pose. These poses can help stretch and strengthen your muscles, improve your balance and flexibility, and calm your mind. Remember to always listen to your body and take it easy if you feel any pain or discomfort. It's also important to stay hydrated and fuel up with healthy snacks before heading out to surf.
